title: Universal Survival Principles
content: SHELTER: Build with what’s around—branches, leaves, tarps, rocks. Insulate from cold ground. WATER: Drink from flowing sources or boil/filter collected water. Avoid standing water near animals. FIRE: Use dry materials. Teepee and log cabin shapes work best. Friction, flint, or sun to ignite. FOOD: Bugs, plants, traps. Avoid anything with white berries or bitter almonds. FIRST AID: Stop bleeding, clean wounds, and splint breaks. Signal for help with mirrors, smoke, or sound.
